pages.text: This filter allows for high-performance matching of up to 54 different items, including optional NBT matching. The Bulk Item Filter can be configured in a few different ways:$(p)$(li)$(thing)Sneak+Right-click/$ the filter against any inventory to merge a copy of that inventory's contents into the filter.

$(li)$(thing)Right-click/$ the filter to open a GUI showing the items currently in the filter. You can add (ghost copies of) items to the filter here, click items to remove them, or press the red $(bold)$(4)X/$ button to clear the filter completely.

$(li)When the filter is in a module that is in a router, you can open the filter's GUI by middle-clicking it, or pressing $(bold)$(4)[$(k:modularrouters.configure)]/$ over it.$(p)$(bold)If/$ the module has a valid inventory targeted, two extra buttons appear on the GUI: a green $(bold)$(2)+/$ button to $(italic)merge/$ the target inventory's items, and a blue $(bold)$(1)=/$ button to $(italic)load/$ the target inventory's items (overwriting the filter's current contents).

This last configuration method is particularly useful combined with a $(l:modules/sender_2)Sender Module/$ to implement a sorting system, since the Bulk Item Filter will remember what should be in an inventory, even if the actual inventory later gets emptied.
